adjective.description: Expressing adverse or disapproving comments or judgments.
examples: he was critical of many U.S. welfare programs

adjective.description: Expressing or involving an analysis of the merits and faults of a work of literature, music, or art.
examples: she never won the critical acclaim she sought

adjective.description: (of a situation or problem) having the potential to become disastrous; at a point of crisis.
examples: the flood waters had not receded, and the situation was still critical

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a point of transition from one state to another.
(of a nuclear reactor or fuel) maintaining a self-sustaining chain reaction.
examples: the reactor is due to go critical in October

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense relating to the crisis of a disease): from late Latin criticus (see critic).
